meanings.definition: To apply a new layer of wax to something.
meanings.sent1: I need to rewax my surfboard before going to the beach.
meanings.sent2: After the car wash, I decided to rewax my car for extra shine.
meanings.sent3: My dad joked that he would rewax his shoes to make them waterproof.
meanings.sent4: The artist decided to rewax his sculpture to preserve its beauty.
meanings.sent5: She had to rewax the floor to make it shiny and clean.

meanings.definition: To cover or coat with wax again.
meanings.sent1: The candle maker had to rewax the old candles to sell them again.
meanings.sent2: I will rewax the skis before the winter season starts.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally rewaxed the cheese, thinking it was a waxed fruit.
meanings.sent4: The antique table was rewaxed to restore its original luster.
meanings.sent5: The boat owner had to rewax the hull to protect it from the saltwater.
